conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D render: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volumes, and an elevated/isometric viewing angle with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; proper angled view. Cutaway is clean, though some openings/wall junctions appear simplified/rounded rather than strictly planar.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (open kitchen/living at left, main bedroom at top-right, bath core near center-right, stairs/right corridor, secondary sleeping area bottom-center). Minor deviations in exact opening shapes and some proportional simplification around the central partition cluster.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present and placed in the expected rooms (kitchen counters/island, sofa/table, beds, bath fixtures). Some items are simplified and not all 2D symbols/features are represented exactly.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable geometry with good lighting and separation of walls/floors/openings. Consistent materials; no obvious mesh breaks. Background is clean with no UI/text labels.

detected_errors.description: Several doors/openings are rendered with curved/rounded forms that do not match the swing-door geometry implied by the 2D plan, reducing strict opening fidelity.
Minor proportional/layout simplifications in the central partition/bathroom cluster (wall junction geometry and exact partition lengths appear slightly altered vs the 2D plan).
Furniture is generally correct but simplified; not every 2D-indicated element (small fixtures/details) is carried through with exact placement/scale.

summary: A true isometric cutaway 3D conversion with strong layout fidelity, with the main inaccuracies coming from simplified/rounded door and partition geometry compared to the 2D plan.
